author: Mary Anastasia O’Grady
title: Lula’s Conviction Is a Win for Brazil
text:
Brazil’s stock market surged in January after an appellate court upheld the bribery conviction of former President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Investor euphoria pushed the benchmark Ibovespa index to a record close, finishing up 5.3% for the week ending Jan. 26.
The market celebrated because the ruling increases the odds that Mr. da Silva won’t be a candidate in the presidential election slated for Oct. 7—and thus won’t return to the presidential palace with his pernicious left-wing populism. 
...
